definition: patent/sth uniquely enjoyed (or possessed etc) by a certain group of people/monopoly
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

sentences.english: Parts for public use and functional segments are the pleas of industri…
sentences.chinese: 公用性和功能性內容是外觀設計專利侵權的抗辯事由。

sentences.english: Some research findings have applied for national patent.
sentences.chinese: 主要研究成果已申請國家專利。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter focuses on the apocalypse and a second think of patent pools.
sentences.chinese: 第四章闡述了專利池所帶來的啓示的反思。

sentences.english: The wheat production method has diet national patent applications, into real trial stages.
sentences.chinese: 烏麥食療生產法已申請國家專利，進入實審階段。

sentences.english: What would you think if one of your cells tried to patent the Krebs Cycle? Silly cells…
sentences.chinese: 當你的一個細胞要三羧酸循環的專利你怎麼想？

sentences.english: Wilson holds a patent on this "Aspherical Propagation Delay" technique.
sentences.chinese: 威爾遜擁有專利的“非球面傳輸時延”技術。

sentences.english: The company has more than ten patents, technical force is abundant.
sentences.chinese: 公司擁有十餘項專利，技術力量雄厚。

sentences.english: It is the best to classify the patent document into the technology field. That the patent document is not classified is practicable.
sentences.chinese: 而專利公報與專利索引宜入技術領域或乾脆不分類。

sentences.english: It is the best to classify the patent document into the technology field. That the patent document is not classified is practicable.
sentences.chinese: 而專利公報與專利索引宜入技術領域或乾脆不分類。

sentences.english: The most common source is to be granted a monopoly by the government, either through patents, in which case the monopoly is temporary, or through a government franchise.
sentences.chinese: 最常見的是由政府授予的壟斷，比如說專利或特許權。

sentences.english: The government gave him his first patent on an electric device he called an Electrographic Vote Recorder.
sentences.chinese: 政府爲他的電記錄計票器頒發了第一個專利。

sentences.english: “As a rule Ford adamantly refused to adopt parts and components patented by others, ” Greenleaf writes.
sentences.chinese: 作爲規定，福特強烈反對接受他人零部件專利。

sentences.english: A patent-pending hinge secures your Kindle to the cover.
sentences.chinese: 正在申請專利的鉸鏈作保你點燃的封面。

sentences.english: Energy-saving home gas stoves have been the national technology patents.
sentences.chinese: 家用節能燃氣竈已獲國家技術專利。

sentences.english: One thing about inventions is that we have something called patents.
sentences.chinese: 關於發明，有個詞叫做專利。

definition: to put to use/to apply/practical/applied (science, linguistics etc)/application/practical use/(computing) app
to target/to focus on/to be aimed at or against/in response to
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
